intro: Chamomilla inodora, commonly known as the wild chamomile, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Chamomilla inodora is often used in traditional medicine for its mild sedative and anti-inflammatory properties.
